meanings.definition: Able to be pursued or followed in order to catch or capture.
meanings.sent1: The fast rabbit was very chaseable by the fox.
meanings.sent2: The butterfly was too chaseable for the cat to resist.
meanings.sent3: The chaseable squirrel led the dog on a merry dance around the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like chaseable clouds, always just out of reach.
meanings.sent5: The shiny object was so chaseable that everyone wanted to grab it.

meanings.definition: Capable of being chased or pursued.
meanings.sent1: The toy car was easily chaseable by the children.
meanings.sent2: The ball was so chaseable that even the tired dog perked up.
meanings.sent3: The chaseable kite soared high in the sky, teasing the kids below.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like chaseable dreams, always slipping away when he tried to grasp them.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh cookies was incredibly chaseable, drawing everyone to the kitchen.
